content:
I couldn't agree more about the importance of film critics in shaping public opinion and influencing a film's success. They play a vital role in helping audiences discover new films and filmmakers, and their reviews can indeed have a significant impact on a film's box office performance.

I also appreciate your nuanced view on film critics being both influential and intimidating. It's essential to recognize that critics' opinions are subjective, and a negative review from a prominent critic can be detrimental to a film's chances. However, it's also important to acknowledge the value that critics bring to the industry by providing thoughtful analysis and critiques that can help audiences make informed decisions about what to watch.

I'm glad you mentioned RogerEbert.com, The A.V. Club, and The Film Comment as your favorite film critics or publications. They are all highly respected and well-known for their in-depth analysis and thoughtful critiques.

Now, I'd love to hear more about your favorite films and filmmakers. Are there any particular genres or directors that you're drawn to? Have you discovered any new favorites at the film festivals you've attended?
